If a 'serious errors' such as an OOME, it'll trigger a pause (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/framework/ToeThread.html#211 
and line 173).

Does the OOME, as far as you can detemine, have an obvious cause (rare 
but sometimes the case)?  You have a maximum of 1.75G up on EC2, IIRC.  
Have you set your heap a good bit less than this?  You might also try 
running with less toe threads.

St.Ack


Ted Dziuba wrote:
>
> Ah, yes, I am seeing OOMEs in ToeThread's run method. If all ToeTheads
> throw exceptions, does the crawl pause?
>
> Ted
>
> Michael Stack wrote:
> >
> > Anything on the consoles about OOMEs? Are the disks full?
> > St.Ack
> >
> > Ted Dziuba wrote:
> > >
> > > We have a few Heritrix instances set up in Amazon EC2 crawling a 
> fairly
> > > small amount of data. We are seeing the crawl pause itself as it goes,
> > > with no indication as to why in the crawl log. What could cause this?
> > >
> > > Thanks for any pointers.
> > >
> > > Ted
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
>
>
